description: This notification is generated by the controller when a
a rogue is detected. The name of the AP that
detected this rogue is sent in the notification.
This object specifies the administrative name
assigned to the AP by the user. If an AP is not configured,
its factory default name will be ap:<last three byte
of MACAddress> eg. ap:af:12:be.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApName

description: This notification is generated by the controller
when a rogue client exceeds its maximum
threshold configured. The details of Rogue AP
and Rogue Clients is sent in the notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientExceededThreshold CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioMACAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioChannelNumber u 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-DOT11-CLIENT-MIB::cldcClientMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11IfType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRuleStateType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDetectedChannel u 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDot11RadioBand s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the base Mac address of
the radio.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioMACAddress

description: This object represents the channel number of the
radio interface of the AP, represented by
cLApDot11IfType.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioChannelNumber

description: This object represents the radio MAC address
common to the dot11 interfaces of the rogue AP.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress

description: This object represents the MAC address of the
client for this entry and uniquely identifies
this entry.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-DOT11-CLIENT-MIB::cldcClientMacAddress

description: This object represents the type of this dot11
interface.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11IfType

description: This object represents the base BSSID of this AP, which
is the MAC address of the radio interface of this
AP.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid

description: This object specifies the rule to configure state of the
rogue.
alert - Configure alert state on rogue ap.
contain - Configure contain state on rogue ap.
internal - Configure internal state on rogue ap.
external - Configure external state on rogue ap.
external - Configure deletion state on rogue ap.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRuleStateType

description: This object represents the rogue
detected channel number.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDetectedChannel

description: This object represents the radio band of the Rouge AP.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDot11RadioBand

description: This notification is generated by the controller
when a rogue client is removed from the rogue AP
and still the client count of the rogue AP is greater
than the maximum threshold configured. The details
of Rogue AP and Rogue Clients is sent in the
notification.

event.Summary: Rogue client removed due to exceeding maximum threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueExceededClientRemovedThreshold CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioMACAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11RadioChannelNumber u 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-DOT11-CLIENT-MIB::cldcClientMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApDot11IfType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRuleStateType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDetectedChannel u 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDot11RadioBand s EXAMPLE

rogue.
alert - Configure alert state on rogue ap.

description: This object represents the rogue
detected channel number.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueDetectedChannel

description: This object represents the radio band of the Rouge AP.

description: This notification is generated by the controller
when a rogue AP is contained due to Rogue Rule.

event.Summary: Rogue AP contained due to rogue rule with level: $v2

description: This object represents the radio MAC address
common to the dot11 interfaces of the rogue AP.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress

description: This object specifies the state of the rogue contained,
Higher the level of containment, more the number of
detecting APs that are used to contain it.
Value between 1 to 4 is for 'contained' state.
Value of 0 means 'contained' state is stopped.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueApContainmentLevel

description: This notification is generated by the controller
when a rogue client is detected.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientDetected CISCO-LWAPP-DOT11-CLIENT-MIB::cldcClientMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLLastDetectingRadioMACAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress x 000eaa12ddff CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueMode i 0 CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientTotalDetectingAPs i 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientFirstReported s EXAMPLE CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientLastReported s EXAMPLE CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientGatewayMac x 000eaa12ddff

description: This object represents the MAC address of the
client for this entry and uniquely identifies
this entry.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-DOT11-CLIENT-MIB::cldcClientMacAddress

description: Last detecting AP of the rogue client.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLLastDetectingRadioMACAddress

description: This object represents the radio MAC address
common to the dot11 interfaces of the rogue AP.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueApMacAddress

description: This attribute is use to specify the state in which
the Rogue AP is user can set the Rogue AP in alert,
known or acknowledge state.
Alert state means Rogue AP can be a potential threat
trap will be sent out to trap recipients.
Known state means its just internal AP which is not
on the same Switch.
Acknowledge state means an external AP whose
existence is acceptable and not a threat (probably
some other company's AP).
Contained means containement is initiated and ongoing.
Threat is usually the state when the rogue is found
on wired network.
known(4), knownContained(9) and trustedMissing(10)
will appear in known rogue list.
known rogues can be pre provisioned and known rogues
state can be changed to alert(2).
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApRogueMode

description: This object represents the total number of
detecting APs that detected this rogue.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientTotalDetectingAPs

description: This object represents the time Stamp
when this Rogue client was First Detected.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientFirstReported

description: This object represents the time Stamp
`when this Rogue client was Last Detected.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientLastReported

description: Gateway Mac Address of Rogue Station.
variables.name: CISCO-LWAPP-ROGUE-MIB::cLRogueClientGatewayMac
